Title: PowerBI Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: PowerBI Developer

Location: Brussels/hybrid

Salary/Rate: Up to 550 Euros per day

Start Date: 11/11/2024

Job Type: Contract - 6 months initially




In scope of the Digital Dashboards initiative, we are looking for a senior to expert level Power BI developer.

The scope of the mission will be to take on the end-to-end design and development of Executive Dashboards on Power BI, building insights on capacity management, operational excellence and a range of other domains to support data driven decision making. The candidate should have an extensive experience in data modeling, analysis and developing data insights. As a must, the candidate masters Power BI (dataflows, Power Query and DAX). The candidate should also have a broad experience in data projects, and will be key to building out the platform for future needs.

The candidate would join a team of 3 internal BI analyst-developers and will work closely with senior business stakeholders.

Skills:

Data Modeling | Senior
Data Platform Design (Datawarehouse or Datalake) | Senior
Power BI | Expert
Python | Professional

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Responsibilities:

Serve as a technology expert to build high-quality data products, demonstrating a commitment to self-learning and continuous improvement.
Collaborate with product teams, architects, and platform experts to ensure timely delivery of user stories with exceptional quality.
Support and develop solutions to enhance business decision-making capabilities by leveraging industry standards, best practices, and data analytics tools.
Apply data integration concepts, including extraction, transformation, loading (ETL), data validation, performance optimization, and debugging.
Possess a solid understanding of data warehousing principles, including relational, columnar, or cloud-based databases.
Understand data modeling techniques such as data marts or dimensional modeling to design effective data structures.




Required Skills:

Strong expertise in SQL programming and debugging.
Hands-on experience with at least one ETL tool, such as:
Microsoft Azure ADF
AWS Glue
Databricks
Wherescape
Alteryx
Matillion
Extensive knowledge of data lakes or data warehouses using technologies like ADLS, Snowflake, or Redshift.




Additional Skills:

Familiarity with various Microsoft Azure or AWS tools.
Experience with API integration for data consumption.
Understanding of data governance and master data management practices.
Experience with data quality tools to implement data validation rules in ETL processes.
Ability to create dashboards and scorecards using Power BI.




Desired Behaviors:

Embrace an agile mindset.
Exhibit customer-centricity and design thinking.
Demonstrate strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Be curious, a quick learner, and possess a structured, analytical mindset.
Show innovation, adaptability, and a willingness to take on new challenges.
Focus on results and continuous improvement.
Maintain a positive attitude and motivate others.
Navigate change effectively and make sound decisions, even in incomplete scenarios.

understanding of Data modeling (Star Schema, Data Vault)

ability to communicate in French

relocation sponsored
a tailor-made career management plan

work-life balance
a phenomenal and supportive team
the opportunity to be a BI Developer with a great community by your side

Title: Data-Engineer (M/V/X)
Company: APB-Association of Pharmacists Belgium-Association Pharmaceutique Belge-AlgemenePharmaceutische Bond
Description:
¬†




De Algemene Pharmaceutische Bond (APB) vertegenwoordigt de zelfstandige officina-apothekers. APB ondersteunt zijn leden in hun dagelijkse praktijk, ontwikkelt en promoot de vrije uitoefening van het beroep van zelfstandig apotheker.¬†




¬†

We streven ernaar om data-gedreven oplossingen te leveren die de prestaties van onze organisatie verbeteren en onze klanten helpen om succesvol te zijn.¬† Als onderdeel van ons groeiende team, krijg je de kans om te werken met de nieuwste technologie√´n en een belangrijke bijdrage te leveren aan onze data gedreven toekomst.¬†




¬†




Data-Engineer (M/V/X)¬†

Als data-engineer speel je een cruciale rol in het bouwen, beheren en optimaliseren van onze data-infrastructuur.¬† Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van robuuste data pipelines, het transformeren van ruwe data in ruwe data in bruikbare formaten en het ondersteunen van onze data-analisten en data scientist bij het uitvoeren van hun analyses.¬†




¬†




Functie:¬†

Ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van betrouwbare data pipelines en ETL-processen.¬†
Integreren van diverse datastromen uit interne en externe bronnen in ons dataplatform.¬†
Optimaliseren van databaseprestaties en waarborgen van datakwaliteit en integriteit.¬†
Samenwerken met data-analisten en data scientists om complexe datasets te modelleren en analyseren.¬†
Ondersteunen bij de implementatie van machine learning modellen in productieomgevingen.¬†
Documenteren van technische oplossingen en processen.¬†

¬†




Profiel:¬†




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in Informatica, Data Engineering of een vergelijkbare richting.¬†
Minimaal 2-3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol.¬†
Ervaring met big data technologie√´n zoals Hadoop, Spark.¬†
Vaardigheid in programmeertalen zoals Python, Java.¬†
Grondige kennis van SQL en ervaring met relationele databases zoals PostgreSQL of SQL Server.¬†
Ervaring met het ontwerpen van data warehouses en data lakes.¬†
Ervaring met DBT (Data Build Tool) voor het modelleren en transformeren van datasets.¬†
Vaardigheid in het opzetten en onderhouden van Snowflake-datamodellen.¬†
Ervaring met de integratie van data in BI-tools zoals QLIK Sense en QLIK NPrinting.¬†
Bekendheid met het beheren en aansturen van processen via Airflow voor het orkestreren van data pipelines.¬†
Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.¬†

¬†

Je kan zowel zelfstandig werken als in teamverband.¬†
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels, Frans is een pluspunt.¬†
Proactieve en oplossingsgerichte werkhouding¬†

¬†

¬†




Aanbod:¬†




Een competitief salaris en aantrekkelijke extra-legale voordelen¬†
Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot telewerk¬†
Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling¬†¬†
Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving¬†
Vlotte bereikbaarheid met het openbaar vervoer¬†¬†

Interesse:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†




Gelieve uw motivatiebrief en CV naar jobs@apb.be te sturen. Voor bijkomende inlichtingen kan u contact opnemen met Annelies De Greef, HR Manager op het nummer +32-(0)2-285.42.21.¬† Neem ook zeker een kijkje op www.apb.be¬†




Show more
HTML:
De Algemene Pharmaceutische Bond (APB) vertegenwoordigt de zelfstandige officina-apothekers. APB ondersteunt zijn leden in hun dagelijkse praktijk, ontwikkelt en promoot de vrije uitoefening van het beroep van zelfstandig apotheker. 


 

We streven ernaar om data-gedreven oplossingen te leveren die de prestaties van onze organisatie verbeteren en onze klanten helpen om succesvol te zijn.  Als onderdeel van ons groeiende team, krijg je de kans om te werken met de nieuwste technologie√´n en een belangrijke bijdrage te leveren aan onze data gedreven toekomst. 


 


Data-Engineer (M/V/X) 

Als data-engineer speel je een cruciale rol in het bouwen, beheren en optimaliseren van onze data-infrastructuur.  Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van robuuste data pipelines, het transformeren van ruwe data in ruwe data in bruikbare formaten en het ondersteunen van onze data-analisten en data scientist bij het uitvoeren van hun analyses. 


 


Functie: 

  • Ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van betrouwbare data pipelines en ETL-processen. 
  • Integreren van diverse datastromen uit interne en externe bronnen in ons dataplatform. 
  • Optimaliseren van databaseprestaties en waarborgen van datakwaliteit en integriteit. 
  • Samenwerken met data-analisten en data scientists om complexe datasets te modelleren en analyseren. 
  • Ondersteunen bij de implementatie van machine learning modellen in productieomgevingen. 
  • Documenteren van technische oplossingen en processen. 

 


Profiel: 


  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in Informatica, Data Engineering of een vergelijkbare richting. 
  • Minimaal 2-3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol. 
  • Ervaring met big data technologie√´n zoals Hadoop, Spark. 
  • Vaardigheid in programmeertalen zoals Python, Java. 
  • Grondige kennis van SQL en ervaring met relationele databases zoals PostgreSQL of SQL Server. 
  • Ervaring met het ontwerpen van data warehouses en data lakes. 
  • Ervaring met DBT (Data Build Tool) voor het modelleren en transformeren van datasets. 
  • Vaardigheid in het opzetten en onderhouden van Snowflake-datamodellen. 
  • Ervaring met de integratie van data in BI-tools zoals QLIK Sense en QLIK NPrinting. 
  • Bekendheid met het beheren en aansturen van processen via Airflow voor het orkestreren van data pipelines. 
  • Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden. 

 

  • Je kan zowel zelfstandig werken als in teamverband. 
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels, Frans is een pluspunt. 
  • Proactieve en oplossingsgerichte werkhouding 

 

 


Aanbod: 


  • Een competitief salaris en aantrekkelijke extra-legale voordelen 
  • Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot telewerk 
  • Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling  
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving 
  • Vlotte bereikbaarheid met het openbaar vervoer  

Interesse:     


Gelieve uw motivatiebrief en CV naar jobs@apb.be te sturen. Voor bijkomende inlichtingen kan u contact opnemen met Annelies De Greef, HR Manager op het nummer +32-(0)2-285.42.21.  Neem ook zeker een kijkje op www.apb.be

Title: Junior BI Consultant
Description:

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master‚Äôs degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years‚Äô experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 1884, Bulgari‚Äôs name has today become emblematic of Italian excellence. Perfectly blending tradition and modernity, Bulgari uses its rich history to inspire audacious designs and produce truly colorful creations making us unique. Internationally renowned, from our roots in jewelry and watches we have branched out into accessories, perfumes and luxury resorts. Excellence, enthusiasm and passion are the chemistry of everything we do.

In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :




Senior Data Analyst




As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.




Job responsibilities




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.




Profile




With a Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.




You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.




As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.




Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you‚Äôve got big plans ‚Äì so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people‚Äôs lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: February 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Title: Data Engineer Intern (Python)
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Data Engineer Intern (Python) to be a part of our Inflation Trading Team for a 6-month internship in Zug, Switzerland, starting immediately. This is an exciting position offering opportunities to gain exposure to software development and portfolio management practices at a global hedge fund.

Position Responsibilities


Aid in the development of new lines of business solutions using Python, and SQL
Develop and implement Python-based pipelines to collect inflation-related alternative data from online sources
With the support of the data team, build relational database schemas and manage data ingestion, transformation, tooling and automation
Document the data pipelines and models to ensure reproducibility, clarity, and ease of future maintenance
Provide support for in-house and 3rd party applications


Qualifications & Desired Skills


Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Quantitative Finance
Experience with the Python ecosystem of common libraries and working knowledge of at least one statically typed language
Good grasp of computer science fundamentals (e.g. data structures, algorithms, operating systems etc.)
Familiarity with object-oriented programming
Strong problem-solving skills and commitment to high standards for code
Interest or prior experience in the financial trading industry (particularly in fixed income) a plus
Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time-sensitive team environment
Detail-oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don‚Äôt fulfil every listed qualification.

We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Would you like to join a multicultural and cross-functional team to solve exciting data challenges, and make a real impact with MSF teams on the field?

If the answer is yes, apply now to meet Deborah, Mohammed, Patrice, Francois and cie and learn more about this great opportunity!




Context & Mission

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).

The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

MSF OCG employs approximately 450 HQ staff located primarily in Geneva with teams in Zurich, Dakar and Amman and another 6,000 internationally mobile staff located in 30 countries worldwide working across 110 of our humanitarian projects.

MSF, including OCG, has grown significantly over the last 10 years and until now the HR department has managed that expansion with ad-hoc tools and methods.

To better support the ongoing demands and better serve our global workforce, OCG has launched a transformative HR initiative with one critical pillar being the introduction of an HR Information System (HRIS).

Joining a dynamic team of HR professionals, the IT Data Analyst will analyse the as-is and define the to-be data structure and flow required to support the data migration activities and implementation of HRIS integration. They will produce deliverables based on guideline and methodology provided by Data by the Data architect. The incumbent will collaborate with IT Business Analysts, Functional Referrents, HR SMEs, Data Migration specialists and Integration team to produce relevant artefacts and deliver a robust data migration process and the integration between HRIS component and peripheral systems. The HR Data Analyst will report to the Data Lead and IT Project Manager.

At MSF you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to making a meaningful impact in the world. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with passionate colleagues, and contribute to positive change on a global scale.




Responsibilities

As the HR Data Analyst, your role is pivotal in optimizing our human resources data infrastructure to support the delivery of end-to-end HRIS solutions encompassing the deployment of a new HR solution (Workday) loaded with HR data (current and historical), inbound and outbound integrations.

You will:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and document data requirements and priorities
Contribution to the production of data quality standards in our HRIS, ensuring accurate reporting and compliance
Define the integration flow of data across the relevant systems to ensure data consistency and accuracy
Cultivate collaborative relationships with IT business analysts, application managers and functional referrents to align data with business processes
Identify data requirements and workflows for an effective HRIS implementation
Design our HR data flows, data mapping and conversion rules for the data migration
Extract source data, develop conversion scripts, reconciliation scripts and continuously improve them through-out the end-to-end delivery lifecycle
Analyse data quality for in the context of data migration and system integration, recognise patterns and make recommendations to the team
Work closely with the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with regulations
Control the quality of the data team‚Äôs deliverables (e.g. peer review) and test the data outputs generated by data migration scripts and system integrations tools
Support and participate to the program‚Äôs testing activities
Submit deliverables for review and feedback by the Data Architect. Incorporate feedback




Your Profile

Experience

Proven track record in data modelling and analysis, ideally with HR and in an international environment
Experience in data migration, integration and reporting
Experience in development of data migration scripts (extraction, conversion, reconciliation, cleansing)
Has contributed to an end-to-end vision for the data integrity across various applications across a given landscape (ideally HR data integrated with Active Directory, payroll, and other consumers of HR data)

Experience with

HRIS platforms
HR analytics tools
Datawarehousing
ETL Processes
Data modelling and development tools

Languages

English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).

Skills/ Technical competencies

Excellent proficiency in data analysis, data modeling, and using these skills to influence process definition.
Proficiency with data management tools, with the ability to implement them effectively in a low data maturity context.
Ability to work within cross-functional teams on strategic projects, bringing a data-focused perspective: data catalog, data cleansing, data migration.
Strong communication skills and active collaboration to design the desired data flow and structure.
Ability to collaborate with IT, HR, legal, and compliance teams to ensure data security.
Previous experience as a data analyst is required, with experience in HR projects being a plus
Familiar with requirements and knownledge management tools such as Jira, Microsoft Sharepoint, Visio

Personal Abilities/Qualities

Analytical and organized
Pragmatic
Positive, good communicator
Collaborative and a team player
Great documentation skills
Ability to link functional requirements with data




Terms of Employment

Vacancy for 2 positions
Full-time position 100% (40h/week)
Fixed-term contract, 18 months
Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
Ideal start date: January 6th, 2025
Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 93‚Äô504.- to CHF 107‚Äô280.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.




How to apply

Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. ‚Äì letter of motivation 1p. max. ‚Äì in French or English.

Deadline for application is November 3rd, 2024.

We reserve the right to close the position early if we consider the number and quality of applications received to be sufficient.

APPLY HERE

The applications will be treated confidentially.

Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Only applications submitted on our recruitment platforms will be considered.

Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

Show more
HTML:
Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don‚Äôt fulfil every listed qualification.

We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Would you like to join a multicultural and cross-functional team to solve exciting data challenges, and make a real impact with MSF teams on the field?

If the answer is yes, apply now to meet Deborah, Mohammed, Patrice, Francois and cie and learn more about this great opportunity!


Context & Mission

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).

The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

MSF OCG employs approximately 450 HQ staff located primarily in Geneva with teams in Zurich, Dakar and Amman and another 6,000 internationally mobile staff located in 30 countries worldwide working across 110 of our humanitarian projects.

MSF, including OCG, has grown significantly over the last 10 years and until now the HR department has managed that expansion with ad-hoc tools and methods.

To better support the ongoing demands and better serve our global workforce, OCG has launched a transformative HR initiative with one critical pillar being the introduction of an HR Information System (HRIS).

Joining a dynamic team of HR professionals, the IT Data Analyst will analyse the as-is and define the to-be data structure and flow required to support the data migration activities and implementation of HRIS integration. They will produce deliverables based on guideline and methodology provided by Data by the Data architect. The incumbent will collaborate with IT Business Analysts, Functional Referrents, HR SMEs, Data Migration specialists and Integration team to produce relevant artefacts and deliver a robust data migration process and the integration between HRIS component and peripheral systems. The HR Data Analyst will report to the Data Lead and IT Project Manager.

At MSF you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to making a meaningful impact in the world. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with passionate colleagues, and contribute to positive change on a global scale.


Responsibilities

As the HR Data Analyst, your role is pivotal in optimizing our human resources data infrastructure to support the delivery of end-to-end HRIS solutions encompassing the deployment of a new HR solution (Workday) loaded with HR data (current and historical), inbound and outbound integrations.

You will:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and document data requirements and priorities
  • Contribution to the production of data quality standards in our HRIS, ensuring accurate reporting and compliance
  • Define the integration flow of data across the relevant systems to ensure data consistency and accuracy
  • Cultivate collaborative relationships with IT business analysts, application managers and functional referrents to align data with business processes
  • Identify data requirements and workflows for an effective HRIS implementation
  • Design our HR data flows, data mapping and conversion rules for the data migration
  • Extract source data, develop conversion scripts, reconciliation scripts and continuously improve them through-out the end-to-end delivery lifecycle
  • Analyse data quality for in the context of data migration and system integration, recognise patterns and make recommendations to the team
  • Work closely with the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with regulations
  • Control the quality of the data team‚Äôs deliverables (e.g. peer review) and test the data outputs generated by data migration scripts and system integrations tools
  • Support and participate to the program‚Äôs testing activities
  • Submit deliverables for review and feedback by the Data Architect. Incorporate feedback


Your Profile

Experience

  • Proven track record in data modelling and analysis, ideally with HR and in an international environment
  • Experience in data migration, integration and reporting
  • Experience in development of data migration scripts (extraction, conversion, reconciliation, cleansing)
  • Has contributed to an end-to-end vision for the data integrity across various applications across a given landscape (ideally HR data integrated with Active Directory, payroll, and other consumers of HR data)

Experience with

  • HRIS platforms
  • HR analytics tools
  • Datawarehousing
  • ETL Processes
  • Data modelling and development tools

Languages

  • English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).

Skills/ Technical competencies

  • Excellent proficiency in data analysis, data modeling, and using these skills to influence process definition.
  • Proficiency with data management tools, with the ability to implement them effectively in a low data maturity context.
  • Ability to work within cross-functional teams on strategic projects, bringing a data-focused perspective: data catalog, data cleansing, data migration.
  • Strong communication skills and active collaboration to design the desired data flow and structure.
  • Ability to collaborate with IT, HR, legal, and compliance teams to ensure data security.
  • Previous experience as a data analyst is required, with experience in HR projects being a plus
  • Familiar with requirements and knownledge management tools such as Jira, Microsoft Sharepoint, Visio

Personal Abilities/Qualities

  • Analytical and organized
  • Pragmatic
  • Positive, good communicator
  • Collaborative and a team player
  • Great documentation skills
  • Ability to link functional requirements with data


Terms of Employment

  • Vacancy for 2 positions
  • Full-time position 100% (40h/week)
  • Fixed-term contract, 18 months
  • Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
  • Ideal start date: January 6th, 2025
  • Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 93‚Äô504.- to CHF 107‚Äô280.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
  • Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
  • Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
  • Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.


How to apply

Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. ‚Äì letter of motivation 1p. max. ‚Äì in French or English.

Deadline for application is November 3rd, 2024.

We reserve the right to close the position early if we consider the number and quality of applications received to be sufficient.

APPLY HERE

The applications will be treated confidentially.

Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Only applications submitted on our recruitment platforms will be considered.

Title: Data Engineer / Analyst
Description:
In this exciting role, you will be responsible for the development and operation of our end-to-end data streams, from the main source to data visualization. Your main tasks include:


Supporting internal and external stakeholders with data-based questions related to energy economics, as well as micro- and macroeconomic issues.
Data analysis and creation of visualizations based on IT infrastructure principles and self-service management.
Management of dedicated SQL databases, necessary data integration processes, and web visualizations, including documentation of necessary services.


Requirements

For this position, we are looking for a self-reliant, motivated person eager to actively contribute to the environment. You bring the following qualifications:


Higher education (HES/Uni/EPF/EPFL) in business informatics, business administration, economics, data science, or a related field.
Affinity with data science, such as the ability to extract, prepare, visualize, and comment on information from large datasets.
Proficiency in SQL, FME, and Tableau.
Strong team spirit, structured work approach, and willingness to independently and sustainably solve data-related problems.
Excellent command of German and good command of English, both written and spoken; knowledge of French is an asset.


Benefits

We offer you varied and stimulating tasks within a unique company in Switzerland. You will benefit from the following advantages:


A modern working environment within a motivated team, in close proximity to Aarau train station.
Flexible working hours (42 hours per week) with the possibility of remote work.
25 to 30 days of leave as well as collective leave between Christmas and New Year.
Solid social security and attractive retirement plan.
Opportunities for professional development.
Favorable financial and organizational conditions for internal and external training.
Competitive salary and recognition of good performance.

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It‚Äôs Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Title: Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science
Description:
Job Title:

Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of commodities trading and data science?

At Gunvor, we're on a mission to empower the next generation of talent in the industry. Our Global Graduate Program is your gateway to an incredible adventure, where you'll build the skills and knowledge that will set you on the path to success.

Your role:

As a Quantitative Analysis/Data Scientist Graduate at Gunvor, you will play a crucial role in our data analytics and research team. This 12-month rotational program will provide you with hands-on experience in quantitative analysis, data science, and market research. You will have the opportunity to work on real projects and gain valuable insights into the commodities trading industry.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market data to identify trends and patterns.
Develop quantitative models and algorithms.
Collaborate with our market research team.
Gain exposure to trading strategies and risk management.



Qualifications:


Recent university's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
0-12 months of work experience (ideally in commodities).
Strong numerical aptitude and coding skills (Python, C#).
Proficiency in statistical analysis.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic market conditions.



What We Offer:


A structured and comprehensive training program.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities for personal and professional development.
A competitive compensation package.



Selection Process:

Our selection process is designed to find the brightest talents who are eager to embark on this incredible journey. Here's how it works:

Applications: We look forward to receiving your applications as of the 1st of October 2024.

Screening & Assessment (Up until December, 2024): Our recruiters will diligently screen applications as they are submitted and match the information to our selection criteria.


Assessment: If your application passes the initial review, you'll be invited to participate in our online assessments. Here, we get to see your numerical, cognitive, and problem-solving skills.
Initial Interview: Successful candidates from the assessments will proceed to an interview where we'll discuss your qualifications, experiences, and your passion for the commodities trading world.



Selection Days (January 2025): The final stage includes our face-to-face Selection Days, scheduled for January 2025. This is a fantastic opportunity for us to get to know you better, and for you to learn more about Gunvor.

If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Informatica Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Your skillset:


Should have 8-10 years of experience in Informatica PowerCenter/Data Quality
Should have good knowledge and understanding of Data Management, experience in data integration and data governance solutions (especially data quality), data warehousing / Big Data/ Hadoop / RDBMS, Data management tools and technologies implementation.
Should have strong communication skills and is able to liaise effectively with various teams
Team management & handling experience, able to work effectively with Offshore team


Your Key Responsibilities


Able to handle local data exceptions raised in central data platform and application-level data check failures and warnings
Monitor all data quality related exceptions irrespective of origination
Analyze root causes with support from Business Analyst, Product Owners & Business users
Liaise with Hosting services/Upstream/Downstream Application teams for respective DQ issues
Track data issues to remediate/closure e.g. revising threshold values or revisit validations rules or coordinating with Biz users and upstream system for changes into data feeds
Provide expertise and recommendations to team members in resolving DQ issues
Define process flow/work arounds for addressing known issues/errors, maintain documentation and initiate process improvements
Understand transactional and reference data and analyze/investigate DQ exceptions
Understanding of trade surveillance applications

HTML:
Description

Your skillset:

  • Should have 8-10 years of experience in Informatica PowerCenter/Data Quality
  • Should have good knowledge and understanding of Data Management, experience in data integration and data governance solutions (especially data quality), data warehousing / Big Data/ Hadoop / RDBMS, Data management tools and technologies implementation.
  • Should have strong communication skills and is able to liaise effectively with various teams
  • Team management & handling experience, able to work effectively with Offshore team

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Able to handle local data exceptions raised in central data platform and application-level data check failures and warnings
  • Monitor all data quality related exceptions irrespective of origination
  • Analyze root causes with support from Business Analyst, Product Owners & Business users
  • Liaise with Hosting services/Upstream/Downstream Application teams for respective DQ issues
  • Track data issues to remediate/closure e.g. revising threshold values or revisit validations rules or coordinating with Biz users and upstream system for changes into data feeds
  • Provide expertise and recommendations to team members in resolving DQ issues
  • Define process flow/work arounds for addressing known issues/errors, maintain documentation and initiate process improvements
  • Understand transactional and reference data and analyze/investigate DQ exceptions
  • Understanding of trade surveillance applications

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Your tasks:




Responsible for being the Product Owner of Analytic Platform
Assemble appropriate data to monitor key performance indicators
Offer optimal digital experience to internal users
Analyze and optimize the usability of digital systems using app and web analytics tools
Drive business insights through data modeling and machine learning techniques using Python/R and SQL
Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, ETL tools such as Prefect, Apache Airflow and AWS Glue







Your qualifications:




Experience with MS Power BI
Familiar with Azure cloud-based data infrastructure and services
Profound knowledge of app and web analytics tools and demonstrated skill and experience using these analytics to understand and optimize the usability of digital systems
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and ETL tools (e.g., Prefect, Apache Airflow, AWS Glue)
Familiarity with cloud-based data infrastructure and services (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure)
Experience with data modeling and machine learning techniques
Track record with Python/R and SQL to drive business insights.
Comfortable working with Git and the command line
Experience in the retail or the health sector is a plus.
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in German and English.
Strongly interested in Digital Health and in creating and shaping innovative solutions







Your benefits:




The chance to work on a leading analytic platform with an innovative and prestigious organization
A highly motivated team and an open way of communication

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
üì£ Qim info, who are we?




An IT engineering and digital services company founded in 2004, Qim info has offices in Switzerland (Geneva, Lausanne, Zurich & Basel) and France (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). As part of the MoOngy group, the company also benefits from an international development network.

As the 3rd largest IT company in French-speaking Switzerland (ICT Journal), Qim info is above all a group of consultants capable of intervening at all levels of an information system in different fields (Research & Development, Functional, Infrastructure & Networks, Data, DevOps, etc.) and different business sectors (Banking, Finance, Insurance, Luxury, Retail, Aeronautics, etc.). With over 650 employees, we're always on the lookout for new talent!

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)




üìÑYour tasks:




‚Ä¢ Serve as a primary contact for a designated community of users

‚Ä¢ Participate to delivery of the following services: gathering requirements, taking and following up user

requests, translating business requirements into functional and technical specifications, suggesting

process improvements, performing internal acceptance testing, and supervising user acceptance testing

‚Ä¢ Participate in incident resolution, data extraction and other operational activities in support of specific

business applications

‚Ä¢ Participate to meetings with business users and IS personnel for defining, prioritizing and resolving user

requests (day-to-day or project-related)

‚Ä¢ Advise super-users on application usage, finding solutions and proposing workarounds when appropriate

‚Ä¢ Participate in project preparation activities

‚Ä¢ Support the IBS team and IS in improving internal processes




üíº Technical skills required:




‚Ä¢ Strong IT background, especially in application development, testing and support

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills and ability to deal efficiently with complex or multi-functional issues

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of business process analysis techniques and tools (Miro, Bizagi, Jira, Confluence, ‚Ä¶)

‚Ä¢ Advanced experience in translating business requirement into User Stories.

‚Ä¢ Extended experience in Agile SCRUM methodology with proof of experience in similar business

domains. (perfumery, food industry, R&D, Pharma)

‚Ä¢ Customer service oriented, flexible and open minded

‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel to support application rollouts and other project activities

‚Ä¢ Fluent in English




üèÜ Job conditions

Permanent contract
100% working time
TT: 2 days teleworking per week
ASAP start date
Location: Geneva




üíº Your profile




Deliver key services, including:

o Gathering and documenting business requirements.

o Handling and following up user requests.

o Translating business needs into functional and technical specifications.

o Proposing process improvements.

o Coordinating and supporting User Acceptance Testing (UAT).

o Advise super-users on application usage, finding and proposing workarounds.

o Coordinating system-wide changes across multiple platforms.

o Leading and participating in Unit Testing and UAT activities.

o Contribution to the testing strategy (both definition and execution phases)

‚Ä¢ Manage L2 and L3 support, handling incidents in your area of responsibility.




üôå Why to choose Qim info?




üõ† Recognised expertise in the world of consultancy, with an activity focused on ten or so business sectors and knowledge of all IT professions.

ü§úü§õ Close proximity to our consultants and high-quality HR and management support to help them develop their skills and carry out their day-to-day assignments.

ü•≥ Joining us also means sharing more than just a coffee break! Qim tech talks, company evenings... We organise a whole host of events every year, so you'll have plenty of great memories to share!




üîé Want to find out more?

We look forward to receiving your application üòä

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
SQL Developer




Are you an experienced SQL Developer with at least five years of experience working with SQL, and T-SQL? You have strong experience developing data management and integration platforms as well that you have some experience working in the financial or asset management industry. Then this could be your chance!




You will be responsible for managing the entire development lifecycle from requirements analysis over development, testing, rollout, and maintenance for data quality management, data integration, and reconciliation tools. At the same time, you will Implement data quality checks and data reconciliation procedures as SQL solution as well as Ensure reconciliation of data integration and initiate remediation efforts with integration developers and data stewards.




You will be part of a key data team within the company and have the chance to work together with stakeholders and different IT (Information Technology) teams. Naturally, the role requires you to have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent English skills are necessary for this role as well as any German skills are an advantage. Lastly, you should be solution and goal-oriented and be able to work independently.




For more information on this SQL Developer position or any other Data positions we have available, send your CV to daniel.imre@nicollcurtin.com or you can call me at +41 43 215 45 15

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Interested in Python/SQL/Azure/Spark tech stack? Apply now as we are currently looking for a Data Engineer in the Zurich area to join our client‚Äôs team.




In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure that enables emission monitoring algorithms. You will work on the quality and scalability of data pipelines, enabling customers to reduce their gas emissions.

You‚Äôll work closely with a dynamic and interdisciplinary team of engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on the solution architecture and challenges of developing new IoT solutions.




The ideal candidate has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, data engineering, or a related field, solid experience in big data processing frameworks like Apache Spark, cloud data engineering (preferably on Azure), and proficiency in Python and SQL. Experience with CI/CD (GitHub Actions) and DevOps is an advantage.




As this is a German-speaking environment, German is required for day-to-day communications.




Just so you know, this position is limited to Swiss citizens, Swiss work permit holders without sponsorship, and residents of the EU/EFTA zone. Visa and permit sponsorship options are not available. Candidates without said requirements cannot be considered.




If you‚Äôre ready to be part of a dynamic team, send your CV to mateja.petrovic@nicollcurtin.com as we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team‚Äôs and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland ‚Äì flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland ‚Äì we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (Circular Programs & Innovation)
Description:
In short

We are looking for an innovative and data-focused leader to drive the program objectives, measurement strategy, and analytics efforts for primarily Cyclon, our overarching circularity program. You will play a critical part in defining the success metrics, improving data quality, reporting, and providing insights that influence strategic decisions around the program. This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability and circular business models, coupled with expertise in data analysis and a strong growth-centric mindset.




Your mission

Collaborate with teams across e.g. Strategy, Innovation and Commercial to define clear Cyclon business objectives alongside the program execution and scaleup. Identify key improvement areas and act as the point of contact for measurement, data analytics, and research.
Lead efforts in defining and implementing customer journey tracking mechanisms that capture interactions and touchpoints across the entire Cyclon program lifecycle. Provide insights into customer feedback and engagement to optimize touchpoints and improve overall experience.
Work closely with the Cyclon core team to ensure the integrity of data collection and analysis around operational and customer experience (CX) metrics and derive insights that help drive the direction of the program. Assess the impact of our efforts and use internal and external insights (e.g. market data) to make suggestions on further growth opportunities.
Take ownership of assessing our existing Cyclon data landscape, then build and execute on blueprints for the future of our program reporting especially as it relates across sales channels. Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality, ensuring high-quality, actionable insights.
Define key KPIs and measures of success as well as establish the source of truth for performance reporting. Establish benchmarks and assess the commercial viability of both the existing program and new initiatives, and present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders to guide program evolution. Own standardized (e.g. monthly) reporting on the program and establish reporting frameworks for new programs.




Your story

You have 5+ years of experience as Data or Business Analyst in a Retail/Commercial/Consulting business, with experience in sustainable/circular programs a major plus.
You come with a clear understanding of the Commercial landscape including Ecommerce, merchandising, customer, product and brand KPIs.
You have experience translating strategy into action, building business cases and assessing feasibility of new business ventures using data and insights gathered from a variety of sources.
You are proficient in using query languages such as SQL, and have experience working with complex datasets. Experience with other analytical languages such as Python or R are considered a plus.
You are a strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator, with the ability to take workstream ownership, partner with different functions, and effectively move projects and topics forward.
You have experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau, to provide insightful dashboards and visualizations.
You have a very strong analytical and quantitative mindset with a demonstrated ability to interpret and leverage data to drive decision making.




What We Offer

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically ‚Äì to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose.

On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.

Title: Consulting & Analytics Summer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging ‚Äì where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world ‚Äì helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech‚Äôs and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age. Exemplary projects:


How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?


VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of an Intern Consultant:


Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Internal Visa projects and clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.


Visa‚Äôs Summer Intern Programme:

Our Summer Internship is an 11-week programme providing you the opportunity to experience all that Visa has to offer alongside completing challenging work, building your skillset, and networking with fellow interns and Visa employees. Throughout the internship you will work on BAU work within your team, be given an end-to-end project to complete and take part in a variety of trainings to increase your learning. You will also get the opportunity to take part in a global social impact case challenge as well as hearing from senior leaders through our Visa Executive Speaker Series. The internship is just the beginning of what we hope will be a lasting career at Visa! If you are successful throughout your internship, you could even secure a graduate role with us when you finish university.

Our 2 Summer Intern cohort dates are:


10th June- 22nd August
1st July ‚Äì 19th September


By joining VCA as a Summer Intern you will:


Work alongside an experienced and dynamic team, as well as top clients, expanding your knowledge in the payments sector and our consulting practices.
Gain access to ad hoc training resources such as Buddy, Mentor, your own learning path, project coaching and more to accelerate your career plan, such as Visa University.
Develop your management consulting skills in a market leader consulting organization, with top-notch practices


Qualifications

Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Our campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our team to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We‚Äôre looking for the next generation of change agents ‚Äì dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

Therefore, our requirements are few:


Be in your penultimate year of university, including any further master's degrees or courses. Meaning your education will be complete in 2026.
Full, permanent, right to work for the location you applying to. Visa will not provide sponsorship for this role.
Fluent in both English and local language
Interest in technology and the payments industry


Desired Skills:


Strong communication skills ‚Äì Oral and written fluency in local language and English is required.
Curious mindset with an interest in solving problems alongside strong analytical and quantitative skills, driving insight from data analysis.
Proactive attitude with experience of being a self-starter, a willingness to learn and to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate.


Additional Information

If you require any support during the recruitment process for any reasons, including those related to a disability, please let us know and we will be in contact to discuss this with you.

This is a hybrid position, employees are expected to work from the office 3 days a week (determined by leadership/site),

Please submit your CV in English.‚ÄØ

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
